isis.stitle: SPRING ASSEMBLIES AND SHOCK ABSORBERS - MAINTENANCE - RETIGHTENING U-BOLT NUTS

svcproc.title: RETIGHTENING U-BOLT NUTS
svcproc.para: For both new vehicles and for those having spring service, retighten the U-bolt nuts at the intervals listed below to the values found in the TORQUE CHART.

item.para: Tighten the U-bolt nuts after the vehicle has operated under load for 1,000 miles (1,600 kilometers) or 6 months, whichever occurs first.
Thereafter, tighten the spring U-bolt nuts every 50,000 miles (80,000 km).

caution.para: Joint integrity is ensured for U-bolts and nuts in like-new condition if they are tightened at 40% of specifications. When checking the integrity of U-bolts and nuts however, always tighten them to values specified in the TORQUE CHART.

note.para: Disassemble, clean and lubricate rusty joints to ensure like-new condition.
